values.description:
Fixes issue #244

The following improvements have been made:

 1. Addition of a ContactManager class that provides an abstract interface to physic engines.

 1. Contact sensor listens to contact message produced by ContactManager

 1. ContactVisual renders normals scaled by force.

 1. A bunch of warning fixes and style fixes.


 1. Can set models to be transparent
values.title: Contact sensor refactor

summary.raw:
Fixes issue #244

The following improvements have been made:

 1. Addition of a ContactManager class that provides an abstract interface to physic engines.

 1. Contact sensor listens to contact message produced by ContactManager

 1. ContactVisual renders normals scaled by force.

 1. A bunch of warning fixes and style fixes.


 1. Can set models to be transparent
summary.html:
Fixes issue #244

The following improvements have been made:

  1. Addition of a ContactManager class that provides an abstract interface to physic engines.

  2. Contact sensor listens to contact message produced by ContactManager

  3. ContactVisual renders normals scaled by force.

  4. A bunch of warning fixes and style fixes.

  5. Can set models to be transparent

values.description:
When modeling highlighting was updated, the calculation of bounding boxes was changed. This caused moving to visuals to break. 

There is also a conflict between camera animation and the viewcontroller, which has been resolved in this pull request. 

I took the liberty of adding documentation to Camera.hh

values.description:
Fix for [Issue 264](#!/osrf/gazebo/issue/264).

The relative pose was being set in Link::Init after the Init had been called for all the children, so that the children would not have the correct pose.

This goes against the recommendation of [a comment in all caps with an exclamation point](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/db3563c7f7ab21ae785aa30395670f6bf55d99f7/gazebo/physics/Link.cc?at=gazebo_1.3#cl-235), but it appears to have fixed the bug and doesn't break any PR2 or drc_robot behavior.
values.title: Fix for Issue 264, relative collision pose not being properly applied

summary.raw:
Fix for [Issue 264](#!/osrf/gazebo/issue/264).

The relative pose was being set in Link::Init after the Init had been called for all the children, so that the children would not have the correct pose.

This goes against the recommendation of [a comment in all caps with an exclamation point](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/db3563c7f7ab21ae785aa30395670f6bf55d99f7/gazebo/physics/Link.cc?at=gazebo_1.3#cl-235), but it appears to have fixed the bug and doesn't break any PR2 or drc_robot behavior.
summary.html:
Fix for Issue 264.

The relative pose was being set in Link::Init after the Init had been called for all the children, so that the children would not have the correct pose.

This goes against the recommendation of a comment in all caps with an exclamation point, but it appears to have fixed the bug and doesn't break any PR2 or drc_robot behavior.

values.description: It looks like it will take a sizeable effort to create a standalone link that can submit or partially autofill an issue for documentation creation, so instead I'm just putting a link to create a new issue on the left-hand menu. I've also added some more details to the mainpage, which is the landing page for the API docs. Nate changed the logo size.

values.description:
Fix for [issue 274](#!/osrf/gazebo/issue/274): gravity disabled on links without collisions.

There may be cases to define a link without a collision and want gravity to act, particularly if the link is subject to other forces or constraints. The user may still disable gravity if desired, but it shouldn't be the default.
values.title: Fix for #274 Don't disable gravity for links without collision

summary.raw:
Fix for [issue 274](#!/osrf/gazebo/issue/274): gravity disabled on links without collisions.

There may be cases to define a link without a collision and want gravity to act, particularly if the link is subject to other forces or constraints. The user may still disable gravity if desired, but it shouldn't be the default.
summary.html:
Fix for issue 274: gravity disabled on links without collisions.

There may be cases to define a link without a collision and want gravity to act, particularly if the link is subject to other forces or constraints. The user may still disable gravity if desired, but it shouldn't be the default.

values.description:
I've made a few changes to gazebo's interface with the bullet physics engine, based on the example of ODEPhysics and some bullet demos.

I've also added a regression test for bullet. Currently it just loads an empty world with the bullet engine, waits several time steps, and verifies that GetSimTime() is greater than zero. I will update the regression tests as capabilities are added. Eventually, we'll want to run the same physics tests on all supported engines.
values.title: Bullet physics engine improvements and regression testing

summary.raw:
I've made a few changes to gazebo's interface with the bullet physics engine, based on the example of ODEPhysics and some bullet demos.

I've also added a regression test for bullet. Currently it just loads an empty world with the bullet engine, waits several time steps, and verifies that GetSimTime() is greater than zero. I will update the regression tests as capabilities are added. Eventually, we'll want to run the same physics tests on all supported engines.
summary.html:
I've made a few changes to gazebo's interface with the bullet physics engine, based on the example of ODEPhysics and some bullet demos.

I've also added a regression test for bullet. Currently it just loads an empty world with the bullet engine, waits several time steps, and verifies that GetSimTime() is greater than zero. I will update the regression tests as capabilities are added. Eventually, we'll want to run the same physics tests on all supported engines.

values.description:
The is a big fix to the right menu in the GUI, and the main window list of view menu items. Also added/updated some convenience functions in Transport to handle request/response processing.

You can now visual the center of mass, joints, and collisions objects for any model.

The is a big fix to the right menu in the GUI, and the main window list of view menu items. Also added/updated some convenience functions in Transport to handle request/response processing.

values.description:
added a camera sensor rate test.

mad `Camera::SetUpdateRate` default to 0 (unlimited), and moved 30Hz limitation default into `UserCamera` constructor, so we are not nesting double throttling in `CameraSensor::Update` and `Camera::Render` calls.
values.title: Fix the 1.3 tests

summary.raw:
added a camera sensor rate test.

mad `Camera::SetUpdateRate` default to 0 (unlimited), and moved 30Hz limitation default into `UserCamera` constructor, so we are not nesting double throttling in `CameraSensor::Update` and `Camera::Render` calls.
summary.html:
added a camera sensor rate test.

mad Camera::SetUpdateRate default to 0 (unlimited), and moved 30Hz limitation default into UserCamera constructor, so we are not nesting double throttling in CameraSensor::Update and Camera::Render calls.

values.title: adding unversioned setup.sh for #297

values.description:
There was a race condition in the bullet regression test when compiled in Debug mode. With help from Brian and `valgrind`, we identified two bugs:

1. The private bool gazebo::World::stop was not initialized in the constructor, which led to the race condition that we saw, in which the physics engine wasn't always starting.

2. `valgrind` identified an increment of an uninitialized pointer in gazebo::Master::RunOnce. The variable `iter` was cleared at the end of this->RemoveConnection, and then was being incremented right after that function call.
values.title: Pair of bugs found by valgrind

summary.raw:
There was a race condition in the bullet regression test when compiled in Debug mode. With help from Brian and `valgrind`, we identified two bugs:

1. The private bool gazebo::World::stop was not initialized in the constructor, which led to the race condition that we saw, in which the physics engine wasn't always starting.

2. `valgrind` identified an increment of an uninitialized pointer in gazebo::Master::RunOnce. The variable `iter` was cleared at the end of this->RemoveConnection, and then was being incremented right after that function call.
summary.html:
There was a race condition in the bullet regression test when compiled in Debug mode. With help from Brian and valgrind, we identified two bugs:

  1. The private bool gazebo::World::stop was not initialized in the constructor, which led to the race condition that we saw, in which the physics engine wasn't always starting.

  2. valgrind identified an increment of an uninitialized pointer in gazebo::Master::RunOnce. The variable iter was cleared at the end of this->RemoveConnection, and then was being incremented right after that function call.

values.description:
Saving worlds through the GUI used to assume that the server was on the same machine as the client. This pull request has the client get the world SDF from the server, and then save it.

This also enables a "Save" menu item that is enabled once the Save As is used.
values.title: Better world saving

summary.raw:
Saving worlds through the GUI used to assume that the server was on the same machine as the client. This pull request has the client get the world SDF from the server, and then save it.

This also enables a "Save" menu item that is enabled once the Save As is used.
summary.html:
Saving worlds through the GUI used to assume that the server was on the same machine as the client. This pull request has the client get the world SDF from the server, and then save it.

This also enables a "Save" menu item that is enabled once the Save As is used.

values.description:
Failure case:

1. Server advertises a topic, and publishes a message on the topic. Both of these things happen before the client starts.

1. The client starts, subscribes to the topic with latching set to true. The message is not received.

Example:
Both the "~/road" and "~/gui" topics have this error case.

This pull request also removes the concept of latching from publishers. This feature has no value, and was not used.
values.title: Latching was not properly passed through

summary.raw:
Failure case:

1. Server advertises a topic, and publishes a message on the topic. Both of these things happen before the client starts.

1. The client starts, subscribes to the topic with latching set to true. The message is not received.

Example:
Both the "~/road" and "~/gui" topics have this error case.

This pull request also removes the concept of latching from publishers. This feature has no value, and was not used.
summary.html:
Failure case:

  1. Server advertises a topic, and publishes a message on the topic. Both of these things happen before the client starts.

  2. The client starts, subscribes to the topic with latching set to true. The message is not received.

Example: Both the "~/road" and "~/gui" topics have this error case.

This pull request also removes the concept of latching from publishers. This feature has no value, and was not used.

values.description:
Style fixes.

This patch allows urdf2gazebo to parse multiple collision and visual elements per link. Since urdf does not have names for collisions or visuals, names are automatically generated upon conversion.

Additionally, there are several code style changes, including some typedef'd boost::shared_ptr's to improve readability.
values.title: Enable urdf2gazebo to parse multiple collision/visual elements per link

summary.raw:
Style fixes.

This patch allows urdf2gazebo to parse multiple collision and visual elements per link. Since urdf does not have names for collisions or visuals, names are automatically generated upon conversion.

Additionally, there are several code style changes, including some typedef'd boost::shared_ptr's to improve readability.
summary.html:
Style fixes.

This patch allows urdf2gazebo to parse multiple collision and visual elements per link. Since urdf does not have names for collisions or visuals, names are automatically generated upon conversion.

Additionally, there are several code style changes, including some typedef'd boost::shared_ptr's to improve readability.

values.description:
Bumped revision to 1.4.0, and created pull request #205 for the fix to GetForceTorque.

Several fixes and updates:

1.  get reasonable joint force torque values and contact forces (analyzed in drcsim)
1.  added arithmetic operator for `double * Vector3`
1.  fix for `ODEJoint::GetForceTorque(unsigned int)` when feedback data structures is not yet setup in ODE
1.  added accessor for getting `Model::jointController` object
values.title: analysis and fix for issue #310

summary.raw:
Bumped revision to 1.4.0, and created pull request #205 for the fix to GetForceTorque.

Several fixes and updates:

1.  get reasonable joint force torque values and contact forces (analyzed in drcsim)
1.  added arithmetic operator for `double * Vector3`
1.  fix for `ODEJoint::GetForceTorque(unsigned int)` when feedback data structures is not yet setup in ODE
1.  added accessor for getting `Model::jointController` object
summary.html:
Bumped revision to 1.4.0, and created pull request #205 for the fix to GetForceTorque.

Several fixes and updates:

  1. get reasonable joint force torque values and contact forces (analyzed in drcsim)
  2. added arithmetic operator for double * Vector3
  3. fix for ODEJoint::GetForceTorque(unsigned int) when feedback data structures is not yet setup in ODE
  4. added accessor for getting Model::jointController object
